content.description: A mellow climb with a great summit view. Gear is nice to protect the opening moves. Follow the bolt line up passed a large ledge before topping out. Appropriately named because of the teeth like quartz crystals the whole way up which provide plenty of great hand and foot holds. These same "teeth" create lots of rope drag, so extending the draws may be beneficial.
content.protection: 9 bolts + chains, optional gear placement to protect opening moves.
content.location: Locate the gully on the southwest edge of the Ephel Dauth mass. Route begins on the right side at the beginning of the gully near the base of the Guardian. The first bolt is above a small pine tree growing out of the rocks. Rap down into the gully to the west with 1 60 M rope.In hiking to this climb, you have to pass "Morannon" (the trail is well-worn to here, worn flat area at base) and then continue up over the minor height-of-land and then down a few feet to the base.

climbs.name: The Guardian
climbs.fa: Pete DeLannoy, Karl Braeseke, Paul Muehl 7/19/83

content.description: wonderful corner climb. atypical of the area in the fact that it is not very slabby and kicks you back as you surmount the bulge. this would be a very hard onsight lead as the gear to supplement the old pitons is small and tricky. stem the dihedral and try not to let the bulge push you off.
content.protection: small gear (small nuts, c3 cams) to protect the crux. the seam is thin and shallow. 3 rusty pitons from 1983 haha.
content.location: Locate the route tower of teeth. this is just left. it is an obvious dihedral with a thin seam.

content.description: You can lead tower of teeth and then set up a TR on this and the guardian. or better yet you can lead it. 4 bolts. the crux is going from the 2nd to the 3rd bolt. the crux is a thin traverse and a fall here would be scary, but I don't think it would warrant a pg-13.
content.location: From the Sylvan Lake Store head towards the damn and stay left to walk past the house. Start making your way on the trail shooting between DUET and Riddle. As you approach duet turn left and hug the base of the wall that is the Tower of Teeth. the first route you'll see is wast knot. Continue along the base of the wall and locate the route tower of teeth (1st bolt at ground level). Then turn right and up into the small gully. The guardian face is the obvious face between the route tower of teeth and the dihedral (the guardian).

content.description: The center formation of the TOWERS OF TEETH
